titles.title: El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro Study Act of 1993
El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro Study Act of 1993
El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro Study Act of 1993
El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro Study Act of 1993
A bill to amend the National Trails System Act to provide for a study of El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro (The Royal Road of the Interior Lands), and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S5034)

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/21/1993--Passed Senate amended. El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro Study Act of 1993 - Amends the National Trails Systems Act to designate El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro, extending from Mexico City, Mexico, across the international border at El Paso, Texas, to Santa Fe, New Mexico, for study as a national scenic trail. Requires the study to examine changing routes, and give due consideration to alternative name designations. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to work in cooperation with the Mexican Government (including providing technical assistance) to determine the suitability and feasibility of establishing an international historic route along the El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro.
